rtega_mnemonic:
翌翌RStomorrow, next

purpleculture_examples:
翌日 [ yì rì ]: next day
翌年 [ yì nián ]: the following year; the next year
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below

heisig_constituent: the following, feathers, wings, vase, stand up
heisig_story: Feathers . . . vase. Be sure to contrast the connotation of this keyword with that for next (Frame 510).
koohiiStory1: The following segment is sponsored by...Swiffer - who make excellent feather dusters for cleaning your vases.
koohiiStory2: Your feathers would also stand up if you were a hen in a slaughter house and you heard: "The following!".
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There are some feathers resting on a stand and you and the following of the feathers are following the feathers. The feathers have a following, and you are one member of the following. You and your fellow followers follow the feathers wherever they may go.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine you and the following following the feathers all around. Following the feathers isn’t always easy, but you do it anyway. Imagine touching one of the feathers and feeling the smooth texture on your skin.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: While you and the following are following the feathers from their departure from the stand, one of the members of the following drops an egg and yolk (よく) spills everywhere. What a mess! Being a quick thinker, you use one of the feathers to soak up the yolk and clean up the mess.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine cleaning up egg yolk with a feather. The rest of the following follows your example and takes the other feathers, helping you clean up the yolk.

Ru_trainchinese: yì: (графема) (книжн.) тут же, следом, затем
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the standing (立) feathers (羽) indicate the following
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from the " day ", " wing " sound, and inscription from the " stand " sound. " Day " is the meaning sign, the original meaning is tomorrow, and it is extended to the next and the next. For example, "next day" is tomorrow and the next day; "next year" is the next year, next year, and next year; "next morning" indicates the morning of the next day . " Yi " is older than " Ming ", but the ancient Chinese used " Ming " to replace " Yi " very early.

A Jinwen means the next one, "Compilation" 32935: "Yi Yi Hai", which is the day of Yi Hai tomorrow. Xiao Yu Ding: "Yi You Yi", that is, Yi You Day tomorrow. In ancient times and in unison with the " wing ", " Yi " to represent the " next ", see " wing ", " Yi ." Xu Shen, Duan Yucai, etc. believe that " Yu " is the original word for the meaning of tomorrow, and " Yi " is a false loan of " Yu ". "Said Wen. "Ribu": "Yu, tomorrow is also. From the day, the sound." Duan Yucai's note: "Everything is passed on in the history of the son, the next day is the guise of Yuri, and the next day is the same as the sound of Yu, so it is a phony."

The oracle bone inscriptions are also used as the name of the sacrifice, "Compilation" 22764: "Next to Da (Tai) Jia", "Tai Jia" was the ancestor of the Shang Dynasty, indicating the second sacrifice to Tai Jia.

The Chinese seal is used as the name of the person, "Chinese Seal Character Sign": "Zhang Yi".

" Yi " and " Ying " are connected, "Yinqueshan Hanjian. Jane 602 of "The First Three of Yanzi": "The public is regarded by the public, and the owl fell to the ground with his wings and died off the stage." The " Wing " of "Yanzi Chunqiu" in the Ming movable type is " Yi ". It means that Qi Jinggong sent someone to inspect, and under the high platform in the main hall (found) the owl with its wings spread and died lying on the ground. He also expressed support, "Yi Dai" is like "Wing Dai", that is, supporting support, Qing He Zhuo's "Yi Men Shu Ji." "Zuo Zhuan": "Since the death of Jinxiang, although the courtesy are like Lu, he will no longer wear the emperor." It means that since the death of Lord Jinxiang, although the Zhou dynasty has upheld the rituals like Lu, (but the princes) no longer Support and love the emperor.
humanum_short_description_en: The original meaning of " Yi " is tomorrow, which is extended to next and second.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「日」，「翼」聲，金文加從「立」聲。「日」是意符，本義是明日，引申為下一個、後面一個，如「翌日」是明天、次日；「翌年」是下一年、明年、次年；「翌晨」表示次日早晨。「翌」較「明」古老，但古漢語很早就用「明」來代替「翌」。

　　甲金文表示下一個，《合集》32935：「翌乙亥」，即明天乙亥日。小盂鼎：「翌乙酉」，即明天乙酉日。古時又用同音的「翼」、「翊」來表示「翌」，參見「翼」、「翊」。許慎、段玉裁等認為「昱」才是表示明日義的本字，而「翌」是「昱」的假借字。《說文．日部》：「昱，明日也。从日，立聲。」 段玉裁注：「凡經傳子史，翌日字皆昱日之假借，翌與昱同立聲，故相假借。」

　　甲骨文又用作祭名，《合集》22764：「翌于大（太）甲」，「太甲」是商代先王，表示對太甲進行翌祭。

　　漢印用作人名，《漢印文字徵》：「張翌」。

　　「翌」與「翼」相通，《銀雀山漢簡．晏子一三》簡602：「公令人視之，梟布翼伏地而死乎臺下。」明活字本《晏子春秋》「翼」作「翌」。意謂齊景公派人前往察看，在正廳的高臺下（發現）貓頭鷹張着翅膀，趴在地上死了。又表示輔助，「翌戴」猶「翼戴」，即輔佐擁戴，清何焯《義門讀書記．左傳》：「蓋自晉襄既亡，雖秉禮如魯，亦不復翌戴天子矣。」意謂自從晉襄公死後，雖然周朝好像魯國一樣秉持禮教，（但諸侯）不再擁護愛戴天子了。
humanum_short_description: 「翌」的本義是明日，引申為下一個、第二。

甲骨文從「 日 」，「 翼 」聲，金文加從「 立 」聲。「 日 」是意符，本義是明日，引申為下一個、後面一個，如「翌日」是明天、次日；「翌年」是下一年、明年、次年；「翌晨」表示次日早晨。「 翌 」較「 明 」古老，但古漢語很早就用「 明 」來代替「 翌 」。 甲金文表示下一個，《合集》32935：「翌乙亥」，即明天乙亥日。小盂鼎：「翌乙酉」，即明天乙酉日。古時又用同音的「 翼 」、「 翊 」來表示「 翌 」，參見「 翼 」、「 翊 」。許慎、段玉裁等認為「 昱 」才是表示明日義的本字，而「 翌 」是「 昱 」的假借字。《說文．日部》：「昱，明日也。从日，立聲。」 段玉裁注：「凡經傳子史，翌日字皆昱日之假借，翌與昱同立聲，故相假借。」 甲骨文又用作祭名，《合集》22764：「翌于大（太）甲」，「太甲」是商代先王，表示對太甲進行翌祭。 漢印用作人名，《漢印文字徵》：「張翌」。 「 翌 」與「 翼 」相通，《銀雀山漢簡．晏子一三》簡602：「公令人視之，梟布翼伏地而死乎臺下。」明活字本《晏子春秋》「 翼 」作「 翌 」。意謂齊景公派人前往察看，在正廳的高臺下（發現）貓頭鷹張着翅膀，趴在地上死了。又表示輔助，「翌戴」猶「翼戴」，即輔佐擁戴，清何焯《義門讀書記．左傳》：「蓋自晉襄既亡，雖秉禮如魯，亦不復翌戴天子矣。」意謂自從晉襄公死後，雖然周朝好像魯國一樣秉持禮教，（但諸侯）不再擁護愛戴天子了。

For example, "next day" is tomorrow and the next day; "next year" is the next year, next year, and next year; "next morning" indicates the morning of the next day . " Yi" is older than " Ming", but the ancient Chinese used " Ming" to replace " Yi" very early. A Jinwen means the next one, "Compilation" 32935: "Yi Yi Hai", which is the day of Yi Hai tomorrow. Xiao Yu Ding: "Yi You Yi", that is, Yi You Day tomorrow. In ancient times and in unison with the " wing", " Yi" to represent the " next", see " wing", " Yi." Xu Shen, Duan Yucai, etc. believe that " Yu" is the original word for the meaning of tomorrow, and " Yi" is a false loan of " Yu". "Said Wen. "Ribu": "Yu, tomorrow is also. From the day, the sound." Duan Yucai's note: "Everything is passed on in the history of the son, the next day is the guise of Yuri, and the next day is the same as the sound of Yu, so it is a phony." The oracle bone inscriptions are also used as the name of the sacrifice, "Compilation" 22764: "Next to Da (Tai) Jia", "Tai Jia" was the ancestor of the Shang Dynasty, indicating the second sacrifice to Tai Jia. The Chinese seal is used as the name of the person, "Chinese Seal Character Sign": "Zhang Yi". " Yi" and " Ying" are connected, "Yinqueshan Hanjian. Jane 602 of "The First Three of Yanzi": "The public is regarded by the public, and the owl fell to the ground with his wings and died off the stage." The " Wing" of "Yanzi Chunqiu" in the Ming movable type is " Yi". It means that Qi Jinggong sent someone to inspect, and under the high platform in the main hall (found) the owl with its wings spread and died lying on the ground. He also expressed support, "Yi Dai" is like "Wing Dai", that is, supporting support, Qing He Zhuo's "Yi Men Shu Ji." 翌字的基本解释

翌
yì
明（天，年）：翌日。翌晨（明天早晨）。翌年。

翌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yì］
［《廣韻》與職切，入職，以。］
(1)犹明日之明，次日之次。
(2)昭明。
(3)通“翼”。

翌字的英文翻译

◎ 翌
next

翌字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【羽字部】　翌； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页956第11
【廣韻】與職切。【集韻】【韻會】逸職切，?音弋。明日也。【前漢·武帝紀】翌日親登嵩高。【註】應劭曰：翌，明也。　又【集韻】余六切，音毓。書翌日乙丑。劉昌宗讀。◎按書今文作翼日。翌卽翊字，翊又與翼同。

翌字的源字形

翌字的起名意思

：明天、明年；辅佐，从旁给予帮助；翅膀。

翌
形声字。羽表意,其古文字形体像鸟的羽毛;立(h)表声,其古文字形体像站立的人;“羽”在“立”上,表示鸟在人的上
方飞翔。本义是飞翔的样子。假借为“昱”(yd),表示明日。
明(指时间),次于今日、今年的:~晨|~日|~年。
~晨 ~年 ~日
yì
翌
翌
следующий
Пиктофонетические символы.
На идеограмме Yu, его древние символы подобны птичьим перьям; Li (h) представляет звук, а его древние символы подобны стоящим людям; «Yu» на «立» означает, что птица летит над людьми.
Первоначальное значение - появление полета.
Под маской «Ю» (yd) это означает завтра.
Мин (относительно времени), рядом с сегодняшним днем ​​и в этом году: ~ утро | ~ день | ~ год.
~ утро ~ год ~ день
следующий
следующий
yì
прил.
1) светлый
2) завтрашний, будущий; завтра; назавтра
Radicals: 羽, 立  (feathers, stand)
Meaning Mnemonic
There are some feathers resting on a stand and you and the following of the feathers are following the feathers. The feathers have a following, and you are one member of the following. You and your fellow followers follow the feathers wherever they may go.
Imagine you and the following following the feathers all around. Following the feathers isn’t always easy, but you do it anyway. Imagine touching one of the feathers and feeling the smooth texture on your skin.
Reading Mnemonic
While you and the following are following the feathers from their departure from the stand, one of the members of the following drops an egg and yolk (よく) spills everywhere. What a mess! Being a quick thinker, you use one of the feathers to soak up the yolk and clean up the mess.
Imagine cleaning up egg yolk with a feather. The rest of the following follows your example and takes the other feathers, helping you clean up the yolk.
